metadata.title: Indonesia Dividend & Repatriation Tax 2025
metadata.source: PWC, KPMG, ASEAN Briefing, Ministry of Finance

residentShareholders.appliesTo: Dividends paid to resident individual or corporate shareholders

standardRate.withoutCoD: 20% rate applies if no Certificate of Domicile

treatyRates.description: Reduced rates under tax treaties (if CoD provided)
treatyRates.requirement: Certificate of Domicile (CoD) from home country tax authority
treatyRates.beneficialOwner: Recipient must be beneficial owner of dividends

repatriationIncentive.description: Dividends reinvested in Indonesia can become tax-free

eligibility.exception: Foreign citizens utilizing DTA (Double Tax Avoidance agreement) CANNOT use this incentive

investmentPeriod.individuals: By end of 3rd month after dividend received
investmentPeriod.corporations: By end of 4th month after dividend received

requirements.holdingPeriod: Minimum 3 tax years from investment date
reinvestmentDestinations: Indonesian government bonds (SBN - Surat Berharga Negara)

taxBenefit.description: 100% tax exemption on dividends if reinvested in Indonesia

example.scenario: Foreign investor receives IDR 1B dividend from Indonesian PT PMA

withReinvestment.benefit: Full IDR 1B invested + IDR 100M tax savings

certificateOfDomicile.description: CoD (Certificate of Domicile) required to claim treaty benefits
certificateOfDomicile.purpose: Certify that dividend recipient is tax resident of treaty country
certificateOfDomicile.issuedBy: Home country tax authority (e.g., IRS for USA, HMRC for UK)
certificateOfDomicile.indonesianForm: DGT Form (Directorate General of Taxation Form)
certificateOfDomicile.submissionRequirement: Submit to Indonesian PT PMA BEFORE dividend payment (or withhold 20%)
content: Certification by home country tax authority
commonIssues: Late submission (submitted after dividend payment = 20% withheld)

beneficialOwnerRequirement.description: Recipient must be beneficial owner of dividends to claim treaty benefits
beneficialOwnerRequirement.definition: Person who has full right to use and enjoy dividends (not merely agent or nominee)
disqualified: Conduit companies (pass-through entities with no substance)
Nominees (hold dividends on behalf of others)
substantiveRequirements: Bear risks and rewards of ownership
Have substance in home country (office, employees, operations)

scenarios.example: IDR 1B dividend → IDR 100M withheld OR IDR 0 if reinvested

scenarios.shareholder: Foreign (reinvested in Indonesia, no DTA claimed)
scenarios.example: IDR 1B dividend → IDR 0 withheld (if reinvested within 3-4 months, held 3 years)

forForeignInvestors: Structure via treaty country (Netherlands 5%, Hong Kong 5% for >= 25% ownership)
Consider reinvestment incentive (0% vs 5-20% = significant savings)
Obtain CoD early (2-4 weeks processing time)
Ensure beneficial ownership (avoid conduit structures = DJP disallowance)
forIndonesianCompanies: Plan dividend distribution timing (align with CoD validity)
Verify shareholder details (name, address, TIN must match CoD)
Withhold correct rate (10% resident, 20% non-resident without CoD, treaty rate with CoD)
Issue Bukti Potong (withholding certificate) by month-end
File SPT Masa PPh 23/26 by 10th of following month
reinvestmentStrategy: Timeline: Invest within 3-4 months → Hold 3 years
Example: IDR 5B dividend → IDR 500M-1B tax savings over 3 years

forPTPMAShareholders: Foreign shareholders: 20% standard (or 5-15% with treaty CoD)
Reinvestment incentive: 0% tax if invested in SBN/renewable energy/downstream
Timeline: Individual 3 months, Corporate 4 months (after dividend received)
codApplication: Certified by home country tax authority
commonMistakes: Paying dividend without CoD (forfeit treaty benefit, withhold 20%)
Missing DGT Form (CoD alone not sufficient)
Claiming treaty via conduit company (DJP disallows beneficial owner test)

services: CoD application assistance (liaise with home country tax authority)
baliZeroSupport.cost: IDR 5,000,000 - 15,000,000 (depends on complexity + number of shareholders)
